summary: The Critical Infrastructure Manufacturing Feasibility Act directs the Secretary of Commerce to study the feasibility of manufacturing critical infrastructure products within the United States. The study will identify high-demand, imported products, analyze the costs and benefits of domestic manufacturing, and assess the feasibility of production in rural and industrial areas. A report with recommendations will be submitted to Congress within 18 months of enactment. The bill defines critical infrastructure sectors based on Presidential Policy Directive 21.
